sentences.en: Don't let him mend your bike. He's sure to bungle the job.
sentences.cn: 别让他修理你的自行车. 他肯定会弄得一团糟的.

sentences.en: Fafhrd and the Gray Mouser. Fritz Leiber. A barbarian and master thief band together and bungle their way through encounters with assassin guilds, deadly sorcerers and scheming gods.
sentences.cn: 一个野蛮人和老练的小偷搭伴而行，笨手笨脚地历经了暗杀者公会、致命的巫师和诡计多端的神制造的意外。

sentences.en: I was afraid you would bungle this assignment but I had no one else to send.
sentences.cn: 我担心这份工作给你搞坏了,可是我再也派不出别人了.

sentences.en: If it is found to be contradicted by observation well these experimentalists do bungle things sometimes.
sentences.cn: 如果发现它与观察所得相矛盾——那是有时没把实验做好.

sentences.en: If they insist on keeping it in their own hands , they will only bungle it.
sentences.cn: 勉强干去, 只有贻误.

sentences.en: If you bungle a job, you must do it again!
sentences.cn: 要是你把一件事搞糟了, 你得重做!

sentences.en: It was the result of a bungle: a bureaucratic rule - change misleadingly announced and over - excitedly reported.
sentences.cn: 它实际上是一次失误的结果: 行政命令的变动被错误地宣读,然后又过于激动地被报道了出来.

sentences.en: Mr. Obama told CBS Televison television he takes the blame for the bungle bungled Daschle nomination.
sentences.cn: 奥巴马对CBS说道他应当为汤姆·达舒尔的糟糕任命而接受责备.

sentences.en: Obama told CBS Television , television he takes the plan blame for bungle Dashle bungled Daschle nomination.
sentences.cn: 奥巴马告诉CBS电视台, 他对于任命达谢尔的失误负责.

sentences.en: One day went, calculate do not calculate bungle opportunity?
sentences.cn: 一天过去了, 算不算贻误时机?

sentences.en: That last stupid bungle of his is the end.
sentences.cn: 他那最后一次愚蠢的错误使我再也无法容忍了.

sentences.en: The whole job was a gigantic bungle.
The whole police operation was bungled.
sentences.cn: 警方的整个行动都给弄砸了。

sentences.en: To make a mess of; bungle.

words.tran_cn: 拙劣地工作（bungle的现在分词）

trans.tran_cn: 拙劣的工作，粗制滥造，失败

trans.tran_en: to fail to do something properly, because you have made stupid mistakes – used especially in news reports

trans.tran_cn: 搞糟，搞坏，完不成，笨手笨脚地做
搞糟，完不成，笨手笨脚地做，拙劣地工作
